title: Fix spinners cutting off for Farsi
message:
Fix spinners cutting off for Farsi

This is a hack to fix #849. In summary, there is something about how
Farsi text is measured when it's prefaced with Farsi numbers (the same
doesn't happen with Farsi text without numbers or with Farsi text with
Arabic numbers, for instance). This hack works around this problem by
explicitly updating the layout params for the Spinner to reflect the
calculated width its dropdowns should use. Consequently, this forces
children inflated by the adapter to use that exact width without trying
to calculate a width based on wrap_content.

title: Improve Farsi translations (#847)
message:
Improve Farsi translations (#847)

* Improved Farsi translations:
1) Several incorrect translations were fixed: vertical vs horizontal, before vs after, etc.
2) Some translations did not sound right in the particular context they were used in.
3) Correct spelling rules (e.g., regarding use of ZWNJ) had not been observed.
4) Many translations did not make any sense, or the argument replacement had been placed at the wrong part of the sentence.
5) Almost all missing translatables are now added.

* Android implements the unicode guidelines for plurals:
http://www.unicode.org/cldr/charts/29/supplemental/language_plural_rules.html#fa

Unfortunately this means for Farsi/Persian, we have only "one" and
"other", and "one" is also used for "zero" (which will be ignored if
included).  If we include a specific message for "one" under plurals
(e.g., to say "one tag deleted" instead of "%d tag deleted"), that
will mess up the situation for "zero".

If there is a chance that the plurals might be used for value "zero",
we cannot customize "one".  Therefore, I believe it is safer to only
include "other" to avoid future confusion.

title: Fix broken unit test (#720)
message:
Fix broken unit test (#720)

The unit test called a method that called onNext on a subject. This
subject was subscribed to as an observable to do some extra work, but
was doing this work on an io thread. The bug was that the unit test was
doing the checks before the code that was supposed to run on the io
thread ran (since the unit test itself is synchronous unless we
explicitly wait for something). The fix is to explicitly wait for the
observable to get an event, thereby letting us know that the code was
executed, before checking that the right things were called.

title: Improve Recent pages implementation
message:
Improve Recent pages implementation

Previously, recent pages was doing a database query every time a page
changed in order to update the recent pages table. This patch cleans
this up by batching update information and only writing to the database
in onPause.

It also provides a much cleaner implementation for getting the last page.
Previously, getting the last page meant getting recents and then
returning the last page. This implementation adds an Observable with the
very latest last page seen (even if it hasn't been committed to the
database yet). This observable is prepopulated with the most recent page
from the database and thereafter never depends on the database.

This patch also refactors recent pages out into a RecentPageModel and
adds unit tests for it. A RecentPagePresenter is also added to begin
the process of decoupling business logic from PagerActivity.

title: Avoid an extra delete when it's not needed
message:
Avoid an extra delete when it's not needed

When updating recent pages, we often delete entries, add a new one, and
then prune the list to make sure there are no more than 3 entries. If
our first delete caused us to delete at one row, we don't have to delete
again.

This is an existing bug affecting the current production version as
well. Essentially, if the activity gets killed when you go to change
the is Arabic flag, when you come back, the ViewPager will have its
pages in the wrong order.

This is due to the way that FragmentStatePagerAdapter restores
fragments. This fixes the problem by introducing an item id for each fragment

title: Require unbind to take a type as a parameter.

Require unbind to take a type as a parameter.

This is to fix an edge case - when changing the arabic setting, what
ends up happening is that (assuming the activity doesn't get destroyed)
onResume calls finish() and relaunches QuranActivity. Consequently, the
old fragment gets onStart(), then the new fragment gets onStart(), and
then the old fragment gets onStop(). The old logic cleared the reference
in onStop(), but in this case, we're clearing the wrong reference (and
thus no connections work for the now attached fragment because the old
one caused it to be unattached).

There were two potential fixes for this - one is what this patch does
(check to make sure that what we're unbinding is what's actually bound,
and, if so, unbind). The other option is to use onPause/onResume instead
of onStop/onStart, but will stick to the first solution for now unless
it is deemed unreliable.

title: Fix bugs with permission.
message:
Fix bugs with permission.

Android's shouldShowRequestPermissionRationale only returns true if the
user has been prompted for permissions before and declined (assuming
they didn't select, "never ask me again"). In the previous code, we
always wanted to show rationale before showing the permissions dialog,
so we'd only show it if the rationale dialog hadn't been presented
before (or if shouldShowRequestPermissionRationale returned true).

This is wrong, since the user could say false to our dialog, causing
future launches to return false for both our check as to whether we
showed the dialog and shouldShowRequestPermissionRationale. This patch
fixes this by instead changing the setting to reflect when we showed the
Android permission dialog itself (i.e. called requestPermissions).

Note that part of the work for quran/quran_android#586 (fixing auto
backup) requires that this shared preference not be persisted during
backup. This should be in another patch insha'Allah.

title: Handle next and previous properly.
message:
Handle next and previous properly.

Before, next and previous were flipped for audio (the thinking was that,
due to the text of the Quran being Arabic, that these should flip).
However, recently discovered that the play button (and the previous and
next buttons) are supposed to be global symbols denoting the direction of
the tape. Therefore, for Arabic, the buttons should not be mirrored, nor
should their operations be flipped.

As thus, the next button looks like the play button - it moves the tape
forward. The previous button points in the opposite direction of the
play button and moves backwards (in this case, to the previous verse).

title: Fix parcelable crash when restoring SpinnerCompat.
message:
Fix parcelable crash when restoring SpinnerCompat.

For some reason, we were having issues restoring the state of the
Spinner when reviving the activity (BadParcelableException due to
a ClassNotFoundException).

After much searching and reading, solved the issue with this workaround,
which involves only having saved state in AbsSpinnerCompat instead of
having part of it in the parent and part in SpinnerCompat. This also
turns out to be what ActionBarSherlock's IcsSpinner did as well.

Note that this is a valid fix (though perhaps non-ideal due to
AbsSpinnerCompat not really being a true abstraction), and that, in
addition to fixing the crash, it does persist spinner state (including
the open state of the menu) for something like the JumpDialog. The
remaining spinners (shuyookh list, etc) that aren't persisting have
never persisted before. We should definitely fix this in the future,

We used to maintain a cache of the recently used images. In reality,

title: Replace 1920 width with 1260 on new installs.
message:
Replace 1920 width with 1260 on new installs.

In the existing code, devices with screen widths larger than 1280
would default to using 1920 images. This ended up being problematic
for 2 reasons:

1. there's a limit on the maximum width of an image that can be
loaded on Android. on older devices, this limit is 2048x2048, though
it's significantly higher on new devices.

2. performance - larger images require a larger GL texture, which
causes loading of images to stutter.

Consequently, on all new devices (without existing images), the
app will use 1260 images if the width is greater than 1280. While
these images are slightly lower quality than the previous ones, the
difference is barely noticable, even on a Nexus 6 in landscape mode,
but the performance difference (and the simplification of code that
results from this change) is very noticable.

Also took this opportunity to kill the splash screen.

Fix a plethora of search crashes. Fixes #394.

There were 2 bugs. One is 2.3 only (plurals requires 'other' for
arabic, whereas after 2.3, it doesn't) and was introduced in this
past release.

The second has been happening for a while. Since we use the snippet
sqlite function call in our query, it can sometimes fail since older
versions of sqlite don't support it. While our code was setup to handle
this case by falling back to a simpler query if this one fails, no
exception was thrown until data access occurred, causing us to crash
the app instead.
